justifications: Khan held up a Vote Leave leaflet that suggested Iraq and Syria would soon share the same border with the E.U.
Your campaign has not been Project Fear, it's been Project Hate as far as immigration is concerned.

Davidson launched a strong attack against her fellow Conservative Party member - and potential leadership rival - saying: "You are going to be asked to vote in two days time and all you have heard tonight is 'trust us and it will all be fine' and that's not good enough"
"They [Vote Leave] will not tell us how much the economy will be hit by, they will not tell us how many jobs might go, they will not tell us what they will replace the single market with."
The Remain side wasted no time in attacking the allegedly misleading campaign materials and claims of their opponents.
When Johnson called the E.U. a "job destroying engine"

She won applause by angrily lambasting the opposite side's call to "take back control" of the the country's borders, by withdrawing from free movement rules that have seen up to 3 million Europeans settle in the U.K.
"You lose control by losing your seat at the table."
In rousing ending remarks, Johnson declared that Vote Leave was the side of "hope" and June 23 could become Britain's "Independence Day."
"The in campaign had nothing positive to contribute tonight"
"The leave campaign blew their last chance to give a credible plan for Britain's future."

Pro-Remain Labour MP Chuka Umunna told TIME after the event that a vote to leave would be devastating for Britain's relationship to the wider world as it acts "as an important bridge" to countries like the U.S. and India.
